experience: You and Sean both know Erika Flora PMP, PgMP, ITIL Expert,PRINCE2,CSP, Cody McGinley, and 4 others
Another completed leather project... this one is a leather covered journal
I work with public cloud providers, ISVs and resellers to increase sales and adoption of Chef products.

Worked closely with sales team to close large, multi-year contracts for Chef software subscriptions across all major industry sectors. Called on customers in hospitality, airlines, high tech, logistics and shipping, government, food and beverage, manufacturing, retail, healthcare, automotive, manufacturing, entertainment, gaming, financial, and insurance industries. Presented high-level sales pitches, technical demos, and Q&A sessions with customers. Helped to build the Chef Automate demo framework that enables new demo environments to be provisioned and ready to go in less than ten minutes. Conducted multi-day Chef proof of concept workshops, working hand-in-hand with customer engineering teams to illustrate the value of our automation platform.

Taught Chef Fundamentals training to hundreds of students in both public and private classes. Helped develop the curriculum for Chef Fundamentals and Intermediate training courses. Established local development environments for IHG (Intercontinental Hotels Group) mobile website team. Helped the team to standardize their OS builds to improve efficiency and reduce errors. Taught Chef workshops and trainings at several financial industry clients. Helped multiple customers implement cloud migration strategies including automated infrastructure and software delivery.

Built, secured, maintained and provided troubleshooting and support for over 8,000 Linux servers across several data centers. Developed custom management tools written in Python to expedite deployment process using Cobbler and Puppet.

Installed, configured and provided 24x7 support for a production network of Red Hat Enterprise Linux servers. Responsibilities included setup, configuration and monitoring of Apache, DNS, NFS, FTP, MySQL, and web-based java application clusters.

recommendations: Sean is that rare blend of disciplined engineer, conscientious humanitarian, and empathetic communicator that makes for the best sales engineers and product evangelists. His ability to understand complex topics is exceeded only by his ability to then teach those same topics to others.When speaking with Sean, you feel like the most important person in the room. This natural charisma makes it seem almost effortless, but Sean works extremely hard to build and maintain his customer relationships.Sean also looks at the big picture: He always knows the why of a project, understands the customer's goals, and how the products and resources he has at hand will help deliver those results in a satisfying way. He does all of this from a strong ethical perspective. People throw around the phrase "trusted advisor" all the time, but Sean embodies it.As a communicator, as a technologist, and as a strategist, Sean is an outstanding addition to any team.

Partner Success Leader at Amazon Web Services

I can't recommend Sean strongly enough.  He's a rare combination of deep, full stack technology skills combined with incredibly strong (and sincere) customer skills.  I worked closely with  Sean for almost 4 years, and watched him progress quickly and effectively through a variety of roles at chef (consulting/SA/Partner SA), and succeeding wildly in all of them.  I would frequently get calls from customers who wanted to make a special point of calling out the quality and speed of Sean's impact (these were usually combined with a plea that we keep Sean engaged on their account at all costs!).  Sean is a positive force, that you want on your team, and your customers will want on theirs.

At Chef, Sean has helped enterprise customers and major partners transform their businesses in his multiple roles.  As a consultant, Sean spent time onsite technically enabling customers to get the most from Chef.  As a pre-sales engineer, he gave customers a reason to buy.  As a partner architect, he arms partners with the technical capabilities to position and deliver business and technical outcomes with Chef.  Sean is an amazing cultural asset, delivers tangible results, and articulates business value with Chef technology.  Sean does it all with candor, empathy, and humor.  He's a great teammate and and asset for Chef.

Vice President, Development Operations - DevOps at Mr. Cooper

Sean is one of the most inventive and ingenious Systems Administrators I've encountered in my career.  He is fearless in the face of the unknown and was the de facto Systems Security canon during a tumultuous period in Electronic Arts' Online history.  He is an extremely motivated self-starter with numerous examples of him recognizing a need and providing a solution well before others even foresaw there might be a problem.  Sean couples his passion for technology with an easy going personality for an unbeatable all around package.  I would be ecstatic if our paths were to cross again in the future and will not hesitate to provide a stellar recommendation wherever he may go.

Vanessa is a top-notch project manager with excellent organizational skills, technical knowledge, and the drive to get the job done. I was lucky to have the opportunity to work with Vanessa during a major game launch (Battlefield 3).  She went the extra mile (kilometer?) to make sure that the game launch went smoothly and that all our customers were taken care of.Vanessa has experience managing complex projects including major game launches, data center build-outs and migrations, and technical infrastructure projects. If you have the opportunity, hire this woman!

Sr. Technical Program Manager at Electronic Arts (EA)
April 8, 2013, Nancy was senior to Sean but didn’t manage directly

Sometimes IT project management is compared to herding cats.  Try walking a cat on a leash someday to see how difficult this is.Nancy is one of those rare PMs who somehow manages to consistently get all the cats into the barn on time.  She's got great organizational skills and many years of experience handling complex technical projects.  I worked closely with Nancy on Battlefield 3 to ensure a smooth build-out and game launch.  At every step she kept the cat herd moving in the right direction, in spite of various obstacles and working across different continents and time zones.If you have a problem...if no one else can help...and if you can find her...maybe you can hire...Nancy Stimach!

summary: A strong balance of technical and soft skills makes me an ideal candidate for your sales engineer role. I have experience in pre and post-sales environments, and spent seven years as a system administrator. I require minimal training to be productive. I enjoy travel and can go anywhere to meet with customers face to face. I’m friendly, fluent in both tech speak and business jargon, and I create strong relationships with clients. I can provide technical guidance as well as relationship building, technical project management, and help with expansion and migration efforts.  If you need a solid Sales Engineer - I'm your guy.
name: Sean Carolan
title: Sales Engineer
